main_definition: The primary or most important part, aspect, or feature of something.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Acting as the central figure in a play, movie, or any other performance.
meanings_and_examples.example: In the school play, John played the main character as the hero.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The most important thing; of chief significance or importance.
meanings_and_examples.example: Her advice was always the main point to consider when making decisions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Of principal importance, relevance, or influence in a particular situation or context.
meanings_and_examples.example: The main reason for his success is his dedication and hard work.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Serving as the primary route or path; leading to an important destination.
meanings_and_examples.example: The highway was the main road connecting the city center with the suburbs.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Pertaining to a central concept, idea, or theme in literature, art, or music.
meanings_and_examples.example: The color red often represents passion and love as a key element in various works of art.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In the context of measurements or quantities, it refers to the primary unit from which other units are derived.
meanings_and_examples.example: Liters are commonly used for measuring volume, where 1 liter equals 1 cubic decimeter as a base unit.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A large central body of water in an ocean or sea that contains many smaller bodies of water within it.
meanings_and_examples.example: The Gulf Stream is one of the main currents affecting climate and marine life in the Atlantic Ocean.
